conclusion: Identify the given parameters and relationships
Number of turns of the coil, m = 100
Magnetic flux through each turn of the coil, Φ, varies sinusoidally with time
The graph in Figure (Z) shows that the peak value of the magnetic flux (Φmax) is 2.0 × 10^-2 Wb
Understand the relationship between magnetic flux and EMF
Faraday's law states that the induced EMF in a coil is given by: E = -m dΦ/dt
Φ(t) = Φmax sin(ωt) since the magnetic flux Φ varies sinusoidally with time
Differentiate the magnetic flux function: dΦ/dt = Φmax ω cos(ωt)
Substitute dΦ/dt into Faraday's law: E = -m Φmax ω cos(ωt)
The maximum value of cos(ωt) is 1, so the maximum EMF occurs when cos(ωt) = 1: Emax = m Φmax ω
From the graph in Figure (Z), the period T of the magnetic flux variation can be determined from the x-axis
The period T is the time for one complete cycle, which is 6.28 × 10^-2 s
Determine the angular frequency ω: ω = 2π/T
Calculate the maximum EMF: Emax = 100 × 2.0 × 10^-2 × 100 = 200 V
The maximum value of the electromotive force generated by the alternating current generator is 200 V
